title: England manager Gareth Southgate steps in after Marcus Rashford forgets to clap travelling fans
text:
Show a marc of respect England manager Gareth Southgate steps in after Marcus Rashford forgets to clap travelling fans 
Three Lions chief steers young Manchester United striker towards loyal supporters in Dortmund By Toby Gannon 23rd March 2017, 11:47 am Updated: 23rd March 2017, 12:13 pm Comments GARETH SOUTHGATE reminds Marcus Rashford to thank England’s travelling support after defeat to Germany. 
The dejected Manchester United striker – a 70th minute sub for Jamie Vardy – goes to walk down the tunnel at full-time but is blocked by his boss. Rex Features 5 Gareth Southgate took charge of his first England game after being appointed permanent boss against Germany 
Southgate points towards the away fans, who have travelled over 400 miles to witness the Three Lions play in Dortmund, and tells Rashford to show some appreciation. 
Keep up to date with ALL the England news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
The Three Lions manager is quickly winning over his critics off the pitch. 
But it was not a dream start for the 46-year-old as he watched his dominant side lose to a moment of magic from Lukas Podolski. The Germany international, playing his 130th and final game for his country, belted into the top-right to bow out in style. 
England skipper Gary Cahill admitted he and his team-mates wasted too many chances in front of goal . 
He said: “It’s terrible but we were focused and had a job to do. 
“We had a game to play and we had to give a good account, try and produce a performance with a bit of quality. I felt we did that. We’ve gone into that formation today for the first time. Rex Features 5 Marcus Rashford came on for England as a 70th minute sub in place of Jamie Vardy 
“We had one day when everyone’s been out on the training pitch. It’s difficult to put in a new formation and have everyone grasp it straightaway. But there were a lot of positives from that.”
